name: Heatshield Potion
desc: A miraculous potion that boosts Pyro RES and makes one able to withstand high heat.\nIt works not by cooling the body, but by helping the body acclimate to high temperatures.

name: Desiccant Potion
desc: A kind of potion that boosts Hydro RES and makes one able to withstand highly humid environments.\nIt is said to act like a desiccant and be highly effective at keeping items dry. It can also be ingested for the same effect.

name: Frostshield Potion
desc: A miraculous potion that boosts Cryo RES and makes one able to withstand extreme cold.\nInduces a chilling sensation when drank, but once this sensation spreads throughout the body, the feeling of being cold disappears.

name: Windbarrier Potion
desc: A mysterious potion that boosts Anemo RES and makes one able to withstand strong winds.\nIt works wonders for adventurers out in the world and is even said to keep the cold away.

name: Insulation Potion
desc: A potion that boosts Electro RES and keeps one from getting electro-shocked.\nInduces a tingling sensation when drank. It is said to work by filling the body with inversely charged electrical energy, which counteracts the effect of Electro damage.

name: Dustproof Potion
desc: A potion that boosts Geo RES and keeps one from getting bothered by sand and dust.\nIt has a strange taste not unlike that of magnets. It keeps a traveler clean from all the sand and dust out there.

name: Dendrocide Potion
desc: A potion that boosts Dendro RES and suppresses the growth of plants.\nRather than killing the plants, it puts them in deep hibernation. It's also said to be good for the body if ingested.

name: Flaming Essential Oil
desc: Grants greater affinity for Pyro, boosting Pyro DMG.\nIt is made of materials that gestate Pyro, which serves to draw in Pyro energy more effectively. It also makes the user more fired-up and passionate.

name: Streaming Essential Oil
desc: Grants greater affinity for Hydro, boosting Hydro DMG.\nIt's a slippery medicine for external use, able to better channel Hydro energy. It has a subtle fragrance.

name: Frosting Essential Oil
desc: Grants greater affinity for Cryo, boosting Cryo DMG.\nIt has a chilling sensation when applied, and helps one to better channel Cryo energy. It also helps to keep you cool-headed and calm.

name: Gushing Essential Oil
desc: Grants greater affinity for Anemo, boosting Anemo DMG.\nIt has a fragrant smell. It is said that using it during your travels will make you walk as if you're riding on the wind.

name: Shocking Essential Oil
desc: Grants greater affinity for Electro, boosting Electro DMG.\nIt induces a tingling sensation on the skin and renders the user better able to better channel Electro energy — but comes with a risk of causing an electrical fire that would definitely ruin your perfect hair.

name: Unmoving Essential Oil
desc: Grants greater affinity for Geo, boosting Geo DMG.\nYou can feel the fine Geo pellets within when applied. It's said to help with physical injuries.

name: Forest Essential Oil
desc: Grants greater affinity for Dendro, boosting Dendro DMG.\nIt's a nourishing external medicine that promotes growth of plants, able to better channel Dendro energy.

name: Primordial Essence
desc: Particles condensed by the strength of the original elements. As a basic material, it is widely used in classic alchemy.

name: Slime Condensate
desc: A thick coating found on slimes. Most commonly seen material in elemental workshops.

name: Slime Secretions
desc: Mildly purified slime secretions. Harmful to the skin. Please avoid direct exposure.

name: Slime Concentrate
desc: Concentrated slime essence. When left alone, it will begin to move on its own.

name: Damaged Mask
desc: A broken bone mask that once belonged to some hilichurl.\nNow more broken than complete, it can no longer perform its primary function.

name: Stained Mask
desc: A bone mask, covered in unidentifiable stains, that emanates a mysterious odor.\nYet such is the devotion of hilichurls to masks that they will wear it nonetheless.

name: Ominous Mask
desc: A glossy bone mask with oil markings painted on it, meant to intimidate enemies.\nNo-one really knows why hilichurls are so fascinated with masks. Some say that it's because they don't want to see their own reflections in the water.

name: Divining Scroll
desc: A scroll that likely relates to some kind of magic. Exudes an inexplicable but ominous warmth.

name: Sealed Scroll
desc: An old scroll lacking in detail and clarity. By following the images on it, some magical creatures can recreate a small part of its magic.

name: Forbidden Curse Scroll
desc: A scroll inscribed with ancient images. It is said that few can decipher its meaning, and the few scholars that have all went mad.

name: Firm Arrowhead
desc: A roughly produced arrowhead. Though unimpressive, neither it nor the bow should be underestimated, for even the bravest knight can be felled by an arrow from the rear.

name: Sharp Arrowhead
desc: A well-made arrowhead. Sharp enough to penetrate armor with the ease of a rock through the surface of water.

name: Weathered Arrowhead
desc: An old arrowhead coated in blood. The arrowhead has long since lost its sharpness and thus its use as a weapon.\nHowever, it represents the pride of a hunter and acts as both an amulet and a medal.

name: Heavy Horn
desc: A crude horn used by hilichurls to warn each other. Given the damage to the horn, it won't be warning anyone any time soon.

name: Black Bronze Horn
desc: A metallic monster horn that can only be obtained from especially strong hilichurls, since blowing on the horn takes real strength.

name: Black Crystal Horn
desc: A metallic horn with an ominous shine decorated with black crystals of an unknown source. It has hardly been used at all. It is likely a ceremonial item of the hilichurls'.

name: Gloomy Statuette
desc: A vague portrayal of some unknown person. Even though it has seen many days, it still has not been damaged in any way.

name: Dark Statuette
desc: A carved idol representing an unknown person. Contaminated with a dark and unfathomable power, simply holding it makes you feel uneasy.

name: Deathly Statuette
desc: A carving that emanates an evil energy, with no indication of what it's truly made of. Simply focusing on it evokes dark whispering inside your very soul.

name: Dead Ley Line Branch
desc: Fragile branches from deep within the earth. Even after years of aging, from beneath it's mottled surface you can see that its power is not yet entirely lost.

name: Dead Ley Line Leaves
desc: A twig from deep within the earth. Though it is far from where it once lay, its leaves still pulsate with energy.

name: Ley Line Sprout
desc: It is said that there was a great tree whose roots once spread out to every corner of the world, and this branch is said to be part of it. It is almost if it was never broken off and taken far away, for its vitality is such that it still sprouts new leaves even now.

name: Chaos Device
desc: Comes from ancient defunct relic structures. A part that once held the structure together. Its aesthetically-pleasing engineering is quite exquisite.

name: Chaos Circuit
desc: Comes from ancient defunct relic structures. Was once a logic circuit responsible for movement functions. Sadly, no-one is able to make sense of how it worked.

name: Chaos Core
desc: Comes from ancient defunct relic structures. The core that once drove a mechanical beast. Should you come to understand its workings and reproduce it, you could perhaps change the world.

name: Mist Grass Pollen
desc: Strange spores created by Mist Grass in enclosed spaces. They are the Cicins' favorite food.

name: Mist Grass
desc: Well-preserved Mist Grass. Some would take advantage of the Cicins' love for the Mist Grass to control them.

name: Mist Grass Wick
desc: A rare bundle of Mist Grass that gives off a faint glow. Those who carry it invite both the Cicins and misfortune.

name: Hunter's Sacrificial Knife
desc: A sharp alloy weapon. Though its owner has been lost, it still reflects a disturbingly cold light.

name: Agent's Sacrificial Knife
desc: An oddly-shaped weapon made with superior Snezhnayan technology that once belonged to a senior agent. Proper training is required for using this strange weapon.

name: Inspector's Sacrificial Knife
desc: In the hands of its lord, this fierce weapon has handled many "debts." No-one has eyes in the back of their heads, and this weapon and its related techniques are designed around that weakness.

name: Recruit's Insignia
desc: An insignia to identify the recruits. Makes one wonder about what the ones joining the Fatui's war machine were thinking.

name: Sergeant's Insignia
desc: An insignia with a different shape to distinguish the sergeants from new recruits. Perhaps there are complicated emotions behind it.

name: Lieutenant's Insignia
desc: An armband to identify officers. The Fatui possess a colossal army, so there must be something extraordinary about the ones who achieved this rank within the group.

name: Treasure Hoarder Insignia
desc: A signet that proudly represents its owner's position as member of the Treasure Hoarders. The pursuit of treasure knows no bounds. That said... Is being a thief something to be proud of?

name: Silver Raven Insignia
desc: A raven insignia used by members of the Treasure Hoarders to identify each other. The Treasure Hoarders ask for no resume. Anyone who has an insatiable desire for treasure and is backed up by an equal amount of courage can become a worthy member.

name: Golden Raven Insignia
desc: A raven insignia that symbolizes the pride and the guiding principle of the Treasure Hoarders. Whether it's hidden amidst the vastness of the land or in the depths of the seas, as long as there are treasures to be hunted down, the spirit of Treasure Hoarders, who will stop at nothing to acquire them, will never die.

name: Whopperflower Nectar
desc: Nectar extracted from the stamen of a Whopperflower that contains trace amounts of elemental energy.\nThe taste of the nectar has a hint of Sweet Flower in it.

name: Shimmering Nectar
desc: Nectar that is full of pure elemental energy.\nScholars generally concur that Whopperflowers are advanced life forms among the elemental plants, but there has yet to be a satisfactory explanation regarding their predatory habits.

name: Energy Nectar
desc: A thick and sticky honey that is full of energy.\nThe Whopperflower hunts by tricking its prey, a process it uses to possibly evolve into a more powerful and pure form.

name: Fragile Bone Shard
desc: A bone shard once carried by a Geovishap Hatchling.\nAlthough they are quite fragile, they seem to still harbor some indescribable power.

name: Sturdy Bone Shard
desc: A fragment of an unknown creature's bones that appear to be prized by Geovishap Hatchlings for some reason.\nThe fragment appears to be quite aged. Despite being dragon-like beasts with no spoken language, they still seem to have some sort of special affection for these bone shards.

name: Fossilized Bone Shard
desc: A fossilized bone fragment sometimes found after defeating Geovishap Hatchlings.\nGeovishap Hatchlings all dream of growing into great dragons one day. They see these fossils as dragon bones and greatly cherish them, perhaps because they too hope to attain the dragons' longevity and power.

name: Hurricane Seed
desc: The imploded form of an Anemo Hypostasis upon its defeat.\nContains the essence of Anemo energy.\nIt is said that the power to create hurricanes resides within its seemingly fragile body. This butterfly of pure Anemo energy must surely be waiting for the day when it can conjure up storms once again.

name: Lightning Prism
desc: An Electro Hypostasis channels nearby elemental energy to repair damaged elemental entities. Contains the essence of Electro energy.\nAn ordinary prism separates white light into its component colors; a Lightning Prism, however, channels flowing energy and weaves them into lightning. It will continue to do so even after the Electro Hypostasis has been defeated.

name: Dvalin's Plume
desc: A feather from the tail of the Dragon of the East.\nAs a dragon's feather it has experienced more than a thousand years' worth of winds. One senses within it a yearning for freedom so strong that it could whip up a light breeze to rescue it from its current confines. Its former owner's recognition of you is what makes it content to stay in your hands.

name: Dvalin's Claw
desc: A claw from the Dragon of the East.\nIt once contained the shadow dragon Durin's vile poison, having torn through the latter's flesh in battle. Thanks to your purification and healing, it is no longer toxic.

name: Dvalin's Sigh
desc: A bit of power taken from the whirlwinds evoked by the Dragon of the East.\nBeautiful and transparent, both trade winds and tornadoes will work in his name. The winds move as his companion, his voice, and his freedom.\nHis enemies are the thousands who stand against the wind.

name: Tail of Boreas
desc: A handful of tail scales from the Great Wolf King of the North.\nEven without his physical body and beyond death, Boreas still possesses extraordinary powers. He took a form comprised of ice and wind to embrace a new challenge, but even such a form could not house all of his power. The ice scales that fell during the battle still retain some of their spiritual energy.

name: Ring of Boreas
desc: A bit of crystallized ice from the Great Wolf King of the North.\nThis land was once a realm of freezing-cold blizzards and ice storms filled with razor-sharp ice shards, all at the command of Boreas. Though his power may have diminished, he could still freeze the land in an instant.

name: Spirit Locket of Boreas
desc: A bit of the Great Wolf King of the North's power drawn from its soul.\nThis land was once a realm of freezing-cold blizzards and ice storms filled with razor-sharp ice shards, all at the command of Boreas. In his final moments, he finally realized the chilling north wind could only extinguish life, not nurture it. Therefore, Boreas let his powers freely flow into the land to protect it and its inhabitants.

name: Basalt Pillar
desc: A pillar formed by the shell of a Geo Hypostasis, composed of high-density Geo energy.\nIt is a testament to Geo's status as the heaviest of the elements. Maybe the reason a Geo Hypostasis creates this pillar out of its shell and raises itself is just to get closer to the sky, not to combat enemies.

name: Hoarfrost Core
desc: The exposed core of a defeated Cryo Regisvine. Pure Cryo energy is contained within it.\nEnergy and thoughts that swell deep within the earth will eventually erupt on the surface. Even the deathly silent frost will attach to living things on the ground, turning even ordinary vegetation like vines into huge, vicious predators.

name: Everflame Seed
desc: A seed that fuels the unending flames of the Pyro Regisvine. It emits Pyro energy as if it will burn all that has ever sprouted from the ground.\nEndless desires flow among turbulent energy deep within the earth. What desire could steadily hold such fire to the plants and long so eagerly to bathe everything in unquenchable flames?

name: Cleansing Heart
desc: A palmful of eternal water left by an oceanid.\nThough it has already diffused among the depths of the lake, its purity remains all the same. But why would a creature so pure and clean as an oceanid covet the appearance of a being that roams the land, and assume such a form with pure water? They need not breathe nor do they require sustenance...

name: Tusk of Monoceros Caeli
desc: The horn of a whale that you obtained from defeating Childe, who had unleashed the might of his Delusion.\nIt is said that the shape of one's constellation determines one's character. The image of a whale cruising across the celestial heights represents a solipsism that seeks to crush and devour all in its path.\nEmbracing this aspect of himself, Childe gleefully summoned one such beast before throwing himself into battle against you.

name: Shard of a Foul Legacy
desc: The shard of a weapon that you obtained from defeating Childe, who had unleashed the might of his Delusion.\nIt is stained with a profound color that is not of this world, no doubt due to the land of endless darkness that the young boy saw with his own two eyes.\nPerhaps it has nothing to do with the power of a Delusion, but as they say, the weapon reflects its user...

name: Shadow of the Warrior
desc: A fragment of power that you obtained from defeating Childe, who had unleashed the might of his Delusion.\nIt is the product of a will to fight that has been honed over countless slaughters.\nIf humans do indeed have destinies, then his must surely have been twisted by such deeds. Why else, then, would he always be at the heart of every conflict?

name: Tile of Decarabian's Tower
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThe place now known as Stormterror's Lair was once the capital city of Decarabian, the God of Storms. Since this dream of prosperity was created entirely by his divine might, the broken pieces left behind by the shattering of that dream still possess great power.

name: Debris of Decarabian's City
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nDecarabian, the God of Storms, was content with the capital city he had raised, and accepted the worship of the people from atop his tower. But he knew not that the people did not bow to him out of respect or adoration.

name: Fragment of Decarabian's Epic
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nAndrius once declared war upon Decarabian, but failed to even scratch the capital of the Lord of the Tower. If it were not for the song of freedom that shattered the city in an instant, Decarabian's dream would have gone on forever.

name: Scattered Piece of Decarabian's Dream
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThe people did not bow to Decarabian out of respect or adoration, but because the harsh winds had laid them low. This was the shattered dream and ambition of the Anemo Archon before the rise of Barbatos.\nHe tried so hard to make his dream come true, and so the fragments of that dream are still mighty.

name: Boreal Wolf's Milk Tooth
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nAndrius' wolf pack is its blessed honor guard, and even the milk teeth of a wolf cub possess great potential.\nIn the past, the gods had the responsibility to love all people. Andrius was therefore quite unusual in that he became leader of the wolves, while only welcoming abandoned babies and wanderers when it came to humans.

name: Boreal Wolf's Cracked Tooth
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThe life of a wolf is not without violence, broken bones or cracked teeth are nothing special.\nAndrius found humans to be a disappointment, but believed babies to be innocent. If both the wolf pack and the adopted children chose each other, then they become a Lupical, a fated family.

name: Boreal Wolf's Broken Fang
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThe wolf pack also understands that humans are not solitary creatures. The honorary broken tooth is a parting gift said to bring protection and luck.\nIn the legends of a far-off world, a female wolf once adopted two great humans. Their home was known as the Cave of Wolves, or Lupercal - that word meaning the same thing as Lupical does in this world.

name: Boreal Wolf's Nostalgia
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThe Wolf King, believing himself to despise humans, thought himself unable to envision a happy life for humanity, making him unworthy of becoming the Lord of the Winds of the world. Therefore, he chose to disappear. Yet, in truth, he gazes on the ones abandoned by the world ever so gently.

name: Fetters of the Dandelion Gladiator
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nIt's a human thing to exaggerate a hero's story, even to the point of elevating the fetters that once bound the hero to the level of an enemy of true freedom.\nAs a result, these fetters were granted extraordinary powers.

name: Chains of the Dandelion Gladiator
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThe chains that once bound the great hero Vennessa. In truth, all gladiators would have worn chains in that era, and Vennessa was but one of many.

name: Shackles of the Dandelion Gladiator
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nVennessa was not truly bound by her chains. If she had so wished, no ordinary physical constraints forged in Mondstadt could have held her, for the land there yielded no ore of exceptional quality, nor did it possess the divine flame of her ancestral home.\nShe was only bound by her responsibility to take care of her tribespeople.

name: Dream of the Dandelion Gladiator
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nVennessa may have been freed from slavery, but she then found herself subject to many other, even greater forms of bondage. What began as a duty to her tribespeople extended to all of Mondstadt, then to the concept of freedom itself, and beyond a point even to the whole world.\nWhat she really hoped for, in truth, was that the world might grow stronger.

name: Luminous Sands from Guyun
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThe stone pillars that tower amid the Guyun Stone Forest were once the stone spears Morax used to defeat his enemies. As time passed, the body of these gods penetrated into the pillars, granting them divinity. The pillars sometimes shed fragments of hatred and curses.

name: Lustrous Stone from Guyun
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThe learned know that Guyun Stone Forest is far more than simply a miraculous sight on the sea to behold: It is the cemetery of the former gods of Liyue. Hatred and filth have periodically risen up from it, but all have been subdued by a demon-conquering young man.

name: Relic from Guyun
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThe stone spear has a glimmering core formed by the power of the defeated gods. Their hatred is not directed at Morax, however, for they have lost themselves a long time ago and are incapable of holding personal grudges.

name: Divine Body from Guyun
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThat which lurks within and animates this relic are the divine remains of lamenting gods. They are unrealized ideals, designs for a prosperous humanity that could never be. They may now lie deep within stone and sea, but they will not go quietly into the night.

name: Mist Veiled Lead Elixir
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nJueyun Karst is the realm of the mighty and illuminated adepti. But other than the ability to control the elements of the world, Jueyun Karst is also home to three other untold secrets: Alchemy, Sigils, and Sub-Space Creation.

name: Mist Veiled Mercury Elixir
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nWith Fulu (Sigils), the adepti can store their power in the form of symbols, and with Waijing (Sub-Space Creation) they can fashion a cosmic paradise with the power of their minds. The manufacture of elixirs, however, has always been shrouded in mystery, for certain death follows for any who swallow them.

name: Mist Veiled Gold Elixir
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nElixirs are in fact pills made from metal alloys. They were created by the adepti, and are able to grant weapons transcendent powers. However, they are rarely seen in the world due to the hubris of the practitioners of martial arts, who prized the ways of combat over the paths of the adepti.

name: Mist Veiled Primo Elixir
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nAn elixir of the highest quality. It embodies a state of intertwining order and chaos, and is said to mirror how the world was when it was first created. Of course, a certain someone knows that this was not the case.

name: Grain of Aerosiderite
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nA black meteor once fell beyond Liyue's Sea of Clouds, said to have fallen to vanquish a monster. However, it was stained by powerful tainted blood, so this item no longer possesses the pure power of Rex Lapis.

name: Piece of Aerosiderite
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nRumors of sea monsters are commonplace in Liyue, since the other shore is an unknown region that lies outside of Teyvat. Without the protection of The Seven, all that lies beyond is unknown chaos. Only power beyond the order of Teyvat is able to stain the power of Rex Lapis black.

name: Bit of Aerosiderite
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nThe coastal nations of Teyvat refer to the region beyond the protection of The Seven as the Dark Sea. It is said that many defeated gods refused to live under the new order of The Seven, so they fled to remote islands and became evil gods. However, their powers came from the same source as Rex Lapis, separate from this all-devouring darkness.

name: Chunk of Aerosiderite
desc: Weapon Ascension Material.\nWhen Khaenri'ah was destroyed, a great sinner created endless monsters with dark, alien blood flowing through their veins. They rampaged across the land, destroying all in their paths. They were mutated lifeforms, and the mutations were caused by powers from beyond this world. The black serpentine dragon Durin that attacked Mondstadt was one such mutated being.

name: BEP
desc: Your travel diary contains all that you have experienced in your long journey. These experiences shall someday become the stuff of song.

name: Cake for Traveler
desc:
A souvenir left over from a very special day.

Here's to you, the brightest star in the night sky.
Wishing you a joyous journey in this great big world.

"This must be the first time we've celebrated this special day. Every week, we update the recommended dishes, every month, the moon will send down new blessings, but wow, it's almost nine thousand hours to go before we celebrate this day again!"

name: Wings of First Flight
desc: A stylized wind glider that bears the passionate longing of an Outrider.

name: Wings of Companionship
desc: A stylized wind glider upon which is inscribed the wish to soar together.

name: Wings of Descension
desc: A stylized wind glider that can be used to cross the celestial heights.

name: Wings of Azure Wind
desc: Stylized wind glider. Gifted to you as a mark of Mondstadt's acknowledgment and recognition.

name: Wings of Golden Flight
desc: Stylized wind glider. Gifted to you as a mark of Liyue's acknowledgment and recognition.

name: Wings of Concealing Snow
desc: Stylized wind glider. A gift left behind by a bird of prey that once soared among these mountains.

name: Lantern Fiber
desc: Dropped by <color=#FF5E41FF>the Fatui, hilichurls</color>, and <color=#FF5E41FF>Abyss Mages</color>. Can also be harvested from plants.\nCommon fibrous material that can be processed into lantern wrappings so that the lanterns can float away with their beautiful wishes.\nCan be used in exchange for other materials with <color=#3399CCFF>Manager Xiao</color> in Liyue.

name: Wick Material
desc: Dropped by <color=#FF5E41FF>the Fatui, hilichurls</color>, and <color=#FF5E41FF>Abyss Mages</color>. Can also be harvested from plants.\nCommon wick material that can be processed into lantern wrappings so that the lanterns can float away with their beautiful wishes.\nCan be used in exchange for other materials with <color=#3399CCFF>Manager Xiao</color> in Liyue.

name: Plaustrite Shard
desc: It is formed alongside most <color=#FF5E41FF>minerals</color>. Its magical properties attract both <color=#FF5E41FF>monsters</color> and <color=#FF5E41FF>evil beings</color>.\nA mysterious elemental shard that can float by itself. It is the secret to the xiao lanterns. It is also said to be the thing that powers the Jade Chamber's floating mechanisms.\nCan be used in exchange for other materials with <color=#3399CCFF>Manager Xiao</color> in Liyue.

name: Rime-Worn Fragment
desc: Small crystals obtained from monster habitats on Dragonspine.\nThey are only generated at special times.

name: Rime-Worn Crystal
desc: Pieces of rystal obtained from monster habitats on Dragonspine.\nThey are only generated at special times.

name: Festering Dragon Marrow
desc: Specialized refinement material for Festering Desire.\nThis is the product of purifying Durin's vile venom, which has seeped into and spread throughout Dragonspine's ley lines. By using it on a bloodthirsty sword with a strong affinity for such materials, you can increase that sword's power.

name: Genshin Impact: A New World
desc: Namecard style.\n"Welcome to Teyvat!"

name: Travel Notes: Catch the Wind
desc: Namecard style.\nThe most difficult part of writing a travel journal is coming up with the beginning.

name: Amber: Bunny
desc: Namecard style.\n"It's Baron Bunny!"

name: Klee: Explosive
desc: Namecard style.\nKlee's lucky explosive — can you tell if it's Jumpy Dumpty or Dodoco? (Hint: Look carefully at the tail...)

name: Diluc: Flames
desc: Namecard style.\nMaster Crepus painted many eagles during his lifetime, but he never could've foreseen creating an eagle with such fire.

name: Razor: Wolvensprint
desc: Namecard style.\nIt's quite a sight to behold Razor and the wolves prepare their dinner, but they won't let Klee or the Traveler see the slightly gruesome affair.

name: Venti: Azure Sky
desc: Namecard style.\nThe bright blue of a cloudless sky and the melodious tone of Der Frühling complement each other perfectly.

name: Jean: The Winds' Course
desc: Namecard style.\nThe dandelion, also called "lion's fang" by some, is the flower most sensitive to the direction of the wind.

name: Barbara: Flow
desc: Namecard style.\nWhen Barbara sings, her melodic voice flows like the tender healing of a clear spring.

name: Kaeya: Pavo Ocellus
desc: Namecard style.\nThe pattern of peacock feathers resembles eyes that never shut. Can we really say that this Pavo Ocellus is missing an eye...?

name: Lisa: Tempus Fugit
desc: Namecard style.\nAn hourglass marks the end of the work day for Lisa. Its sand moves fast.

name: Sucrose: Bio-Alchemy
desc: Namecard style.\nIf you closely examine an Anemo Hypostasis before it disappears, you will discover that they are actually quite square.

name: Fischl: Night Raven
desc: Namecard style.\nA raven dark as midnight with wings that can block out the sun. "I permit thee to conceive his likeness upon such decoration!"

name: Noelle: Protector
desc: Namecard style.\nNoelle is quite special. Noelle won't let any harm come to you.

name: Mona: Starry Sky
desc: Namecard style.\nA girl gazes down at the stars' reflection on the water, pondering the joys and sorrows of life.

name: Bennett: Recognition
desc: Namecard style.\nA sign of recognition from Benny's Adventure Team.

name: Xiangling: Fresh from the Pan
desc: Namecard style.\nTry saying this three times fast: "Guoba sears sea snails by Liyue's sea shore."

name: Xingqiu: Rainbow
desc: Namecard style.\nCome watch the night rain that brings no rainbow.

name: Qiqi: Cold Storage
desc: Namecard style.\nWhat should be kept in the fridge? Dr. Baizhu's herbs, coconut milk... and Hu Tao.

name: Keqing: Lightning Stiletto
desc: Namecard style.\nIt was originally invented to just test out one's surroundings and climb to high places, really...

name: Achievement: Explorer
desc: Namecard style.\nAfter all your wanderings throughout the world, do not forget the reason why you first set out.

name: Achievement: Virtuoso
desc: Namecard style.\nAfter mastering these skills, you may just find that you can get by just fine without engaging in battle. If you are without any commission to complete, that is.

name: Achievement: Hero
desc: Namecard style.\nYour hero's journey began before you knew it, but it's the experiences that really made it special.

name: Mondstadt: Whistling Wind
desc: Namecard style.\nListen to the singing of Mondstadt's birds and winds.

name: Liyue: Stillness of Stone
desc: Namecard style.\nWitness the lonely, cloud-covered peaks of Liyue.

name: Achievement: Colors of the Rainbow
desc: Namecard style.\nLight can refract into countless colors, but people stop at seven because they're lazy to count. Perhaps the elements are like that, too.

name: Achievement: Bowmaster
desc: Namecard style.\nDraw that bowstring taut!

name: Achievement: Challenger
desc: Namecard style.\nEven if you're just going out to get a single dandelion, there will be obstacles in your path. But you love a challenge, don't you?

name: Achievement: Deep & Dark
desc: Namecard style.\nThe deeper you delve, the more secrets you shall uncover.

name: Achievement: Hill Dwellers
desc: Namecard style.\nThe hilichurls were dubbed the "hill devils." But a certain young girl named Musk insists on calling them the "hill dwellers."

name: Achievement: Snowy Land
desc: Namecard style.\nYou've heard many stories about Snezhnaya. What does it look like in your mind's eye?

name: Achievement: Cliffhanger
desc: Namecard style.\nThey say that storytellers love their cliffhangers — but you? You've heard it all before.

name: Achievement: Reunion
desc: Namecard style.\nWe shall meet again someday.

name: Ningguang: Phoenix
desc: Namecard style.\nThey say that "more's the pity that phoenixes are few." But seriously, one Ningguang is more than enough...

name: Beidou: Weighing Anchor
desc: Namecard style.\n"Weighing anchor out to sea, one is wont to waver. But look to the skies, and the stars shall light the way."

name: Chongyun: Spirit Blade
desc: Namecard style.\nThis was originally a peachwood sword made of ice. But a big enough ice block makes a better exorcist's tool than peachwood.

name: Achievement: Challenger II
desc: Namecard style.\nThat which awaits at the end of the challenges is...

name: Travel Notes: Fading Star
desc: Namecard style.\nSo long as there is still desire left in your heart, when you hold your head high you will see that which glitters but is not light.

name: Diona: Meow!
desc: Namecard style.\nAll who have Kätzlein blood will have such feline features. An ancient prank played by a certain someone, perhaps?

name: Zhongli: Planet Befall
desc: Namecard style.\nStars fall, light dims.

name: Xinyan: Song's End
desc: Namecard style.\nXinyan only has time to examine her instrument carefully after the performance is over. Even in silence, it is a beauty.

name: Childe: Foul Legacy
desc: Namecard style.\nThis bears all the marks of that fellow who gallivants as he pleases across the continent with his ever-changing combat styles. Yet, his "Foul Legacy" was not originally his. Rather, it was taught to him by that solitary girl who dwelt in the darkest corners of the universe.

name: Mondstadt: Hero's Fame
desc: Namecard style.\nThe name of the Honorary Knight has spread far and wide among the citizenry.

name: Mondstadt: Blessing
desc: Namecard style.\nThey who have it in their hearts to bless others shall themselves be blessed.

name: Liyue: A Thousand Ships
desc: Namecard style.\nMany boats have been numbered by day and night.

name: Liyue: In the Clouds
desc: Namecard style.\nThe peaks adorn the clouded moon.

name: Achievement: Challenger III
desc: Namecard style.\nFinally, a worthy opponent! Our battle will be legendary!

name: Achievement: Snowy Summit
desc: Namecard style.\nA draconian peak must be scaled.

name: Ganyu: Qilin
desc: Namecard style.\nDo no harm to plant nor insect.

name: Albedo: Sun Blossom
desc: Namecard style.\nAllow me to bear witness to this miracle.

name: Travel Notes: Chalk
desc: Namecard style.\nRemember to keep warm when setting foot on the mountain.

name: Frostbearing: Ancient Tree
desc: Namecard style.\nWe shall rise again — the tree of old has sprouted anew.

name: Celebration: Hypostasis
desc: Namecard style.\nMy opponent for today seems to have an artistic temperament.

name: Condensed Resin
desc:
You can hold no more than 3 at a time.
Condensed tree resin that can be used instead of Original Resin to revitalize Petrified Trees and Ley Line Blossoms to receive greater rewards.
Crystal filled with immense energy.
The silver-white Irminsul trees and blossoms are connected to ley lines that have become blocked over time. The energy contained in tree resin can purify the obstructing substance.

name: Instructions: Anemoculus Resonance Stone
desc: Detailed step-by-step instructions for making an Anemoculus Resonance Stone. Master them and you will be able to create a tool to guide you to towards Anemoculi.

name: Instructions: Geoculus Resonance Stone
desc: Detailed step-by-step instructions for making a Geoculus Resonance Stone. Master them and you will be able to create a tool to guide you to towards Geoculi.

name: Diagram: Geo Treasure Compass
desc: A detailed step-by-step diagram for making a Geo Treasure Compass. Use it to easily locate treasure all over Liyue.

name: Diagram: Wind Catcher
desc: A detailed step-by-step diagram for making a Wind Catcher. A Wind Catcher can absorb the energy of Anemograna and release it when needed to create a wind current.

name: Instructions: Portable Waypoint
desc: Detailed step-by-step instructions for making a Portable Waypoint. With a Portable Waypoint, you can create a teleport waypoint wherever in the world you want.

name: Diagram: Adepti Seeker's Stove
desc: A detailed step-by-step diagram for making an Adepti Seeker's Stove. Learn it and you can create a portable stove to bring with you on your travels.

name: Instructions: Condensed Resin
desc: Detailed step-by-step instructions for making Condensed Resin. Using resin in this condensed form to activate certain Ley Line Blossoms and Petrified Trees will increase your efficiency. You can hold no more than 3 Condensed Resin at a time.

name: Diagram: NRE (Menu 30)
desc: A detailed step-by-step diagram for making a Nutrition, Ready-to-Eat (NRE) meal-in-a-pouch. Learn it and you can create a tool that makes ingesting food much quicker.

name: Diagram: Anemo Treasure Compass
desc: A detailed step-by-step diagram for making an Anemo Treasure Compass. Use it to easily locate treasure all over Mondstadt.

name: Diagram: Warming Bottle
desc: Detailed step-by-step instructions for making a Warming Bottle. Master them and you will be able to create a tool to resist Sheer Cold.

name: Memory of the Entombed City
desc: Through this memory, you can master the method to make a Snow-Tombed Starsilver (Claymore).

name: Memory of the Frostbearing Tree
desc: Through this memory, you can master the method to make a Frostbearer (Catalyst).

name: Diagram: Dragonspine Spear
desc: A detailed step-by-step diagram for making a Dragonspine Spear (Polearm).
